name: Cheese
description: Named for its sharply sour aroma, Cheese is an indica-dominant hybrid from the U.K. that has achieved widespread popularity for its unique flavor and consistent potency. With origins that stretch back to the late 1980s, Cheese is said to descend from a Skunk #1 phenotype whose pungent aroma made it stand out. Breeders like Big Buddha Seeds later introduced Afghani indica genetics to increase Cheese’s trichome production and yields. The resulting hybrid is now well-known for its relaxed, happy effects that gently ease you into a blissful state of mind.
descriptionPlain: Named for its sharply sour aroma, Cheese is an indica-dominant hybrid from the U.K. that has achieved widespread popularity for its unique flavor and consistent potency. With origins that stretch back to the late 1980s, Cheese is said to descend from a Skunk #1 phenotype whose pungent aroma made it stand out. Breeders like Big Buddha Seeds later introduced Afghani indica genetics to increase Cheese’s trichome production and yields. The resulting hybrid is now well-known for its relaxed, happy effects that gently ease you into a blissful state of mind.

highlightedReviews.text: This strain is incredible if you have a illness. I know when I had cancer and smoked this strain, it made me so damn hungry and it made all my physical pain go away. It made me forget that I was sick and it uplifted me. I remember buying a half ounce of this strain and I was like holy shit it smells so pungent. I was scared to smoke it lol, but it did the trick and I went from puking and dry heaving, to eating everything in sight! I'm now cancer free and I think I owe most of it to Marijuana.

articles.title: Try These Strains Before Attending Your Next Sporting Event
articles.author: Dante Jordan
articles.text:
If you don’t get high before attending a sporting event, then you’re doing it all wrong. I mean, sure, you can have a good time while being sober, but you can have a great time while being lifted.
So with that said, I curated a list of suggested strains for you to indulge in, depending on which sport you’re going to see. Peep the list, use Leafly’s Finder to locate the dispensaries stocking these strains, purchase, and enjoy some good ol’ sportsball.
Strains to Pair With Exciting Sports (Basketball, Football, Soccer, Hockey)
Sports that fall under this category are the types of sports that include constant back and forth action, which keeps you engaged from start to finish. A big play is always looming, so you’re stuck to the edge of your seat because you don’t want to miss that big dunk or the chance to yell “GOOOOAAALLLLL” in the face of whoever’s sitting next to you. For that reason, you should indulge in strains that’ll have you uplifted and energetic, feeling hyped and ready for that big moment.
  Candyland
Candyland’s a high-THC, sativa-dominant hybrid that’ll have you super smacked without the paranoia. As a mix of Grandaddy Purple and Platinum GSC, it’s got an earthy type of scent and a sweet flavor, with effects that will have you uplifted, engaged, and in a whole entire world of euphoria. Smoke these before an exciting sport and those big plays will feel that much bigger.
Find Candyland Nearby
  Green Crack
Everyone knows how good, energized, and focused Green Crack can make you feel. It’s one of those strains that you can smoke and power through the day like you drank 84 cold brews, so it’s perfect to smoke before a sporting event that you want to be locked into.
Find Green Crack Nearby
  Cotton Candy Kush
Cotton Candy Kush is another high-THC strain that leaves you feeling good, feeling great, feeling great, feeling good, like Outkast on “GhettoMusick.” As a mix of Power Plant and Lavender, its powerful effects are relaxing yet still energetic while inducing happiness, freedom, and overall euphoria, so you’ll be that much more excited when you see that Ronaldo bicycle kick for the game-winning goal live and in person.
Find Cotton Candy Kush Nearby
  Stardawg
Stardawg is one of the best smelling, best tasting, most euphoric, most energetic, most everything strains I’ve ever come across. Gifted to me by LTRMN in Portland, I smoked this and walked around the city for hours, falling in love with everything and everybody. It’s definitely a strain I’d recommend smoking before a sporting event, because every single dunk, touchdown, and goal will likely feel like the greatest moment in sports history for you.
Find Stardawg Nearby
Strains to Pair With Chill Sports (Baseball, Golf, Tennis)
Sports that fall under this category tend to be a lot more laid-back and reserved. Baseball games can be long and boring, and golf and tennis matches require damn near complete silence, with light clapping being the most excited you can get, so if you’re overly hyped at any of them, you may feel a bit uncomfortable or out-of-place. These strains will help you lean a little more towards the indica side of things.
  Obama Kush
Obama Kush is a great indica with a relatively mild THC percentage that’ll chill you out without knocking you out. I smoked a gram joint of Obama Kush a few weeks ago and knocked out the entire first season of Girls Incarcerated on Netflix, which is still shorter than one full-length baseball game.
Find Obama Kush Nearby
  Larry OG
Larry OG is a hybrid of OG Kush and SFV OG, whose indica effects will overtake your body and have you with your feet in the air like your Cares-to-Give Meter is at zero. Smoke a little of this and you’ll have no problem sitting through an entire round of golf, where the most exciting thing possible is a fox running across the course.
Find Larry OG Nearby
  Cheese
Cheese is an indica-dominant hybrid that:

actually smells like Cheese, which is wild; and
will have you feeling relaxed while avoiding the sleepy sleepy nap nap state of mind.

You can smoke some Cheese and kick back in comfort for hours, so if you’re going to see one of the chill sports where everything’s deathly silent and calm, Cheese is a good strain to indulge in beforehand.
Find Cheese Nearby

articles.title: Tips for Growing Blue Cheese Cannabis
articles.author: Leafly Staff
articles.text:
Ever wanted to grow your favorite strain? Leafly and General Hydroponics are teaming up on a series of grow guides that will equip you with all the tips and tricks you need to grow different strains successfully.

Strain Overview: Blue Cheese is a heavy indica strain that was created by crossing UK Cheese and Blueberry. The strain offers a funky cheese-like aroma combined with a unique blueberry scent. It’s a potent strain commonly used by medical patients for pain management.
Grow Techniques: Grow Blue Cheese indoors or outdoors in any medium. You can train the plants to increase yields or top them to help round out the growth. Blue Cheese is a vigorous grower and strong plant that easily resists mold and infections, making it a good choice for novice growers.
Flowering Time: 7-8 weeks
Yield: Moderate
Grow Difficulty: Easy to moderate
Climate: Prefers cool to moderate temperatures between 65 and 80 degrees Fahrenheit.
Indoor/Outdoor: Growing Blue Cheese indoors allows you to easily train the plant. Outdoors is also a good option because of its ability to handle cooler temperatures.
Feeding: Blue Cheese is a strong plant with lots of foliage, and it will need plenty of nutrients to grow. Because of its vigorous growth, it is hard to overfeed. Nitrogen, calcium, magnesium, and silica are great friends to this strain.

growInfo.growNotes:
Prefers moderate amounts of fertilizer
	May express fruity or diesel-smelling phenotypes
	Trains well as a multi-branched plant or with sea of green (SOG) operations
	Average yield falls between 25-30 grams per plant
